alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 01 at 7:42PM EDT until June 01 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN HARRISON...SOUTHWESTERN CARROLL AND SOUTHEASTERN TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES... At 742 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Dennison, or 7 miles east of Uhrichsville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Uhrichsville, Cadiz, Dennison, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, Scio, Midvale, Jewett, Bowerston, Barnhill, and Sherrodsville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
